intro: Terminalia hylobates, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers followed by edible, round, yellowish fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
